name: Tawanda Gona
bio:
My name is Tawanda Gona, I'm 27 and I've been a comedian for 7 years. I started in Boston and came up through The Comedy Studio and later Laugh Boston. I was born in Zimbabwe but I moved to America when I was 2 so I'm pretty much Americanized. I've lived all over the east coast so I have this real sweet non regional dialect that makes me sound sarcastic or cynical all the time. I think the fact that I smile a lot adds to the confusion but I digress. I love Stand Up comedy.
I like to think my act is really representative of me, it deals with where I'm from, how I feel, and the person I'd like to be. Boston's been pretty decent to me however I've lately been longing for more, to be completely blunt I'm tired of being seen as a "novelty". But again, I digress, I love comedy. I put together my own shows because I like to see my peers have fun in an environment I know they'd thrive in. In doing that I've learned what bookers look for and how shows should be run, so the experience has helped me dramatically.
My goals change as time progresses but right now if I could live like Jerry did on Seinfeld I think I'd be satisfied with my career. A couple of late night spots, passed at some clubs, and able to live entirely off a comics salary. Besides that I just want to get better as a stand up and be around people that make me want to be better as a stand up; pretty straight forward.
